prompt: related to American Politics from the past month

message.author: President Joe Biden
message.message: Democracy is not a spectator sport.

message.author: Vice President Kamala Harris
message.message: The fight for justice continues every day.

message.author: Senator Elizabeth Warren
message.message: Our constitution does not belong to a governor or a president; it belongs to we the people.

message.author: Senator Cory Booker
message.message: In a democracy, the pathway to change is engagement.

message.author: Speaker Nancy Pelosi
message.message: Our commitment to democracy must be unwavering.

message.author: Senator Bernie Sanders
message.message: In every generation, young leaders emerge to guide our great nation.

message.author: Secretary Janet Yellen
message.message: Economic prosperity must be shared across our entire nation.

message.author: Senator Ed Markey
message.message: Environmental justice is racial justice.

message.author: Governor Gavin Newsom
message.message: A free press is essential for a functioning democracy.

message.author: Senator Tammy Baldwin
message.message: Healthcare is a human right and should be accessible to all.

message.author: Stacey Abrams
message.message: The power of the vote is the greatest equalizer in our democracy.

message.author: Senator Raphael Warnock
message.message: The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends towards justice.

message.author: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
message.message: We must work together to restore trust in our institutions.

message.author: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
message.message: Climate change is not a distant threat; it's an urgent issue.

message.author: Leader Hakeem Jeffries
message.message: Unity is strength when there is teamwork and collaboration.

message.author: Senator Mitch McConnell
message.message: True patriotism is rooted in the willingness to tell the truth.

message.author: Senator Dick Durbin
message.message: Justice delayed is justice denied.

message.author: Mayor Lori Lightfoot
message.message: The essence of America lies in the heart of its people.

message.author: Governor Andrew Cuomo
message.message: Equality under the law must mean equality for all.

message.author: Senator Marco Rubio
message.message: The American Dream belongs to all of us.

message.author: Senator Ted Cruz
message.message: Our country must be a beacon of freedom for all.

message.author: Senator Amy Klobuchar
message.message: Good governance is the hallmark of a thriving democracy.

message.author: Governor Brian Kemp
message.message: Protecting the vote is protecting the cornerstone of our democracy.

message.author: Governor Ron DeSantis
message.message: Hope and change begin at the ballot box.

message.author: Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms
message.message: Inclusion is not just a value; it's a practice.

message.author: Senator Tim Scott
message.message: Our history motivates us to build a more perfect union.

message.author: Secretary Pete Buttigieg
message.message: The future belongs to those who prepare for it today.

message.author: Governor Larry Hogan
message.message: Public service is a noble calling that demands integrity.

message.author: Mayor Pete Buttigieg
message.message: Strong democracies require strong communities.

message.author: Chief Justice John Roberts
message.message: The law must serve all citizens equally.

message.author: Governor John Kasich
message.message: Faith in democracy must be driven by action, not just words.

message.author: Former President Barack Obama
message.message: Unity and empathy are the bedrock of our civility.

message.author: Former Secretary Hillary Clinton
message.message: Every vote is a voice heard in the chorus of democracy.

message.author: Former President George W. Bush
message.message: Resilience is the hallmark of American spirit.

message.author: Senator Elizabeth Warren
message.message: Economic equality must go hand in hand with political equality.

message.author: Senator Kamala Harris
message.message: Diverse voices make a stronger democracy.

message.author: Senator Chuck Schumer
message.message: A fair judiciary is vital to safeguarding liberties.

message.author: Senator Tim Kaine
message.message: Understanding and compassion bridge divides.

message.author: Representative John Lewis
message.message: Freedom and justice are the birthrights of all Americans.

message.author: Senator Jon Tester
message.message: Protecting freedom means protecting the press.

message.author: Governor Janet Mills
message.message: Transparency and accountability strengthen our democracy.

message.author: Senator Lisa Murkowski
message.message: Constitutional freedoms must be diligently guarded.

message.author: Senator Amy Klobuchar
message.message: Justice must be rooted in equity and fairness.

message.author: Senator Tammy Duckworth
message.message: Advancement in society relies on equal opportunities.

message.author: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
message.message: A resilient democracy thrives on active participation.

message.author: President Joe Biden
message.message: True leadership is defined by service to others.

message.author: Reverend Al Sharpton
message.message: Civil rights are the foundation of our democracy.

message.author: Senator Susan Collins
message.message: Collaboration and bipartisanship can achieve great things.

message.author: Representative Ilhan Omar
message.message: Speaking truth to power is the essence of democracy.

prompt: create a top ten list of the most famous quotes from the world of sports formatted as an array of json objects containing the fields message and author

message.author: Vince Lombardi
message.message: Winning isn't everything, it's the only thing.

message.author: Michael Jordan
message.message: I can accept failure, everyone fails at something. But I can't accept not trying.

message.author: Vince Lombardi
message.message: It's not whether you get knocked down, it's whether you get up.

message.author: Ernie Banks
message.message: The only way to prove you are a good sport is to lose.

message.author: Wayne Gretzky
message.message: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.

message.author: Billie Jean King
message.message: Champions keep playing until they get it right.

message.author: Pelé
message.message: The more difficult the victory, the greater the happiness in winning.

message.author: Michael Jordan
message.message: It’s not about the shoes, it’s about what you do in them.

message.author: Pelé
message.message: Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice, and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do.

message.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
message.message: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.

prompt: create a list of 50 "message of the day" quotes

message.author: Steve Jobs
message.message: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.

message.author: Steve Jobs
message.message: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.

message.author: Frank Sinatra
message.message: The best revenge is massive success.

message.author: Theodore Roosevelt
message.message: Believe you can and you're halfway there.

message.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
message.message: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

message.author: Theodore Roosevelt
message.message: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.

message.author: Albert Schweitzer
message.message: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.

message.author: William James
message.message: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.

message.author: Wayne Gretzky
message.message: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.

message.author: Lewis Carroll
message.message: In the end, we only regret the chances we didn’t take.

message.author: Norman Vaughan
message.message: Dream big and dare to fail.

message.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
message.message: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.

message.author: Confucius
message.message: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

message.author: C.S. Lewis
message.message: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.

message.author: Henry David Thoreau
message.message: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.

message.author: Chris Grosser
message.message: Opportunities don't happen, you create them.

message.author: Zig Ziglar
message.message: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.

message.author: Sam Levenson
message.message: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.

message.author: Mark Twain
message.message: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

message.author: C.S. Lewis
message.message: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.

message.author: Bo Bennett
message.message: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.

message.author: Charles R. Swindoll
message.message: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.

message.author: Albert Einstein
message.message: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.

message.author: Alan Kay
message.message: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.

message.author: Winston S. Churchill
message.message: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.

message.author: Booker T. Washington
message.message: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.

message.author: Buddha
message.message: What we think, we become.

message.author: Dalai Lama
message.message: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.

message.author: Maya Angelou

message.author: Nelson Mandela
message.message: It always seems impossible until it’s done.

message.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
message.message: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.

message.author: Lao Tzu
message.message: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.

message.author: Walt Whitman
message.message: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.

message.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
message.message: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.

message.author: A.A. Milne
message.message: You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.

message.author: Orison Swett Marden

message.author: George Bernard Shaw
message.message: Life is not about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.

message.author: Charles Kingsleigh
message.message: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.

message.author: Helen Keller
message.message: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.

message.author: William Faulkner
message.message: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.

message.author: Vince Lombardi

message.author: Theodore Roosevelt
message.message: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.

message.author: Steve Jobs

message.author: Charles R. Swindoll
message.message: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.

prompt: related to American Politics from the past month

message.author: Barbara Jordan
message.message: Democracy is not a spectator sport.

message.author: Abraham Lincoln
message.message: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

message.author: Theodore Roosevelt
message.message: Nothing worth having comes easy.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: Vote as if your life depends on it, because it does.

message.author: Martin Luther King Jr.
message.message: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.

message.author: John F. Kennedy
message.message: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: A government that is afraid to look after its own people is a government that is doomed to fail.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: Politics is not about the people you elect; it's about the people who vote.

message.author: Audre Lorde
message.message: Your silence will not protect you.

message.author: Amelia Earhart
message.message: The most effective way to do it is to do it.

message.author: Thomas Jefferson
message.message: When the people fear the government, there is tyranny. When the government fears the people, there is liberty.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: We are stronger together than we could ever be alone.

message.author: Nelson Mandela
message.message: Courage is not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: Access to the ballot is a fundamental right.

message.author: Martin Luther King Jr.
message.message: Freedom is never voluntarily given by the oppressor; it must be demanded by the oppressed.

message.author: Groucho Marx
message.message: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly, and applying the wrong remedies.

message.author: Thomas Jefferson
message.message: An informed citizenry is at the heart of a dynamic democracy.

message.author: Martin Luther King Jr.
message.message: The ultimate measure of a man is what he does with his power.

message.author: George W. Bush
message.message: You have to take the initiative and play your game. In a decisive moment, you have to be bold.

message.author: Abraham Lincoln
message.message: Elections belong to the people. It's their decision.

message.author: Sojourner Truth
message.message: Truth is powerful and it prevails.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: Together, we can build a better future.

message.author: Sheryl Sandberg
message.message: Leadership is about making others better as a result of your presence.

message.author: Plato
message.message: The price of apathy towards public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: Each of us is called to become a voice for the voiceless.

message.author: Martin Luther King Jr.
message.message: Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter.

message.author: Mahatma Gandhi
message.message: The future depends on what you do today.

message.author: Mahatma Gandhi
message.message: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.

message.author: Harold Laswell
message.message: Politics is the science of who gets what, when, and how.

message.author: Cesar Chavez
message.message: We cannot seek achievement for ourselves and forget about progress and prosperity for our community.

message.author: Abraham Lincoln
message.message: Democracy is the government of the people, by the people, for the people.

message.author: William James
message.message: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.

message.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
message.message: The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much; it is whether we provide enough for those who have too little.

message.author: Nelson Mandela
message.message: To deny people their human rights is to challenge their very humanity.

message.author: Albert Einstein
message.message: We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.

message.author: Edmund Burke
message.message: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: A vote is a powerful thing; it is the foundation of our democracy.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: Democracy is not a one-time event, but a way of life.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: Your vote is your voice; make sure it is heard.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: Politics is about the lives we touch.

message.author: Unknown
message.message: A democratic government should be accountable to its people.

message.author: Martin Luther King Jr.
message.message: In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.

message.author: Aesop
message.message: United we stand, divided we fall.

message.author: Brené Brown
message.message: Empathy fuels connection; disconnected we are lonely.

message.author: Peter Drucker
message.message: The greatest danger in times of turbulence is not the turbulence; it is to act with yesterday's logic.

message.author: John C. Maxwell
message.message: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.

message.author: Emily Dickinson
message.message: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul.

message.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
message.message: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
